intro: Dammara, commonly known as the African daisies, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It comprises several species native to southern Africa, characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have erect stems and are often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Dammara species are known for their ability to thrive in arid conditions, making them resilient to drought. Their vibrant blooms make them popular in horticulture and garden settings.
